performances.description: NFA -> Easy Wind.  Thrilling transition and a showcase version!

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: Solidly spectacular...very fine
Such a great song anyways, but this version is second to none!
Super...don't miss this one, the boys sure didn't
this one is just smokey and slow and a little off beat like most good versions of easy wind
Three From the Vault - tight as hail!
Powerful Jam
A version all true heads should love, or at least hear once.
Powerful and driving blues jam, with a unique ending. Garcia tears this one up, and Lesh provides a great hollow bass sound.
Relaxed funky
Totally locked in and tight, tight, tight!
Major screw-up of the lyrics here, Pig tries to make up for it and then Jerry just steals the show. I can dig.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: Rippin' Easy Wind with TC high in the mix. This whole show is underrated.

performances.venue: Baton Rouge International Speedway Baton Rouge, LA
performances.description: Wonderful soundboard recording pigpen in fine form, well worth a listen, fantastic show and GREAT quality recording
Quite simply some of the best guitar interplay between Garcia and Weir ever!
Wow long extended version.  Pig was rockin' this evening!!

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: This is an outstanding pigpen show every time he takes the mic he destroys it
Exceptional jamming with a great solo from Weir. Jerry and Bob feed off each other the whole time. Unfortunately, tape cut ends it abruptly.
Smokey gut-bucket blooze. Damned fine.
Another great barn burner from Pig pen, this is one really clean 1969 soundboard. Thanks for the turn on to this show.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Acid soaked Blues riffage ...crispy.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: On a run of listening to early 70 shows and this stopped me short,thought I'd find it atop the list.
Wonderfully relaxed show with a ton of band crowd interaction, this is fabulous stuff, oh to have been there.
Great version, not so great AUD
Another great run thru with pigpen manning the proceedings like the absolute legend he is.

performances.venue: Pauley Ballroom, U. of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Pigpen blows up this extended version absolute POWER.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Pressure cooker here, just bursting with energy. Pig sounds great, Jerry goes full throttle.  AUD quality B only, but worth every second.
Great harp solo, solid smoldering jam. Pig's voice is brilliant.
Undoubtedly one of the greats. Everyone is on. Bobby solos, then Jerry schools the world, then at 7:03 sounds like D. Crosby steps in like Godzilla.
Sweet, sweet Pig. So laid back, this Easy Wind is sleazy as should be.
Beautiful harmonica jamming with Jer.  Perhaps extra 'bluesy' because it's the day after Altamont?
there is not a bad version of this heady pigpen classic.
There is a nice guitar interplay between Jerry and Bobby on this one. Nice bouncy version.
Easy Wind, in its second month, is not quite solid yet, but it has a cool jam in which Pigpen, TC & Garcia are all solo together!
Pigpen The Great Stone Jack Baller
